title: 15. Augustus, Tiberius, and Germanicus
description: The succession arrangements under Augustus and the roles of Tiberius and Germanicus in securing dynastic stability.

questions.question: What was Tiberius’ relationship to Augustus?
Which factor most helped Tiberius’ political career?
In which regions did Tiberius win significant military victories?
Who was Drusus, and why was his death significant?
options: Augustus’ son whose death caused unrest
Tiberius’ brother whose death left Germanicus as heir
Tiberius’ rival whose death strengthened the Senate

questions.question: Why did Germanicus become an important figure in Augustus’ succession plans?
options: He was popular and militarily successful
He married into the imperial family

questions.question: What obligation was imposed on Tiberius when he was adopted by Augustus?
options: To adopt Germanicus as his heir

questions.question: How do the sources portray Tiberius’ acceptance of power?
What role may Livia have played in Tiberius’ rise?
What offices did Germanicus hold unusually early in his career?
In which provinces did Germanicus hold proconsular command?
options: Germania Superior, Germania Inferior, and Gaul

questions.question: How many legions did Germanicus command?
What happened to Tiberius after the death of Lucius?
Which powers were granted to Tiberius that made him Augustus’ equal in authority?
Why was Germanicus’ career accelerated?
options: Due to lack of suitable candidates
Because Augustus wanted to weaken Tiberius
To prepare him as a future ruler

questions.question: What tension existed in the succession arrangements?
options: Tiberius had to favour Germanicus over his own son

questions.question: What does Germanicus’ popularity suggest about Augustus’ succession policy?
options: It aimed to combine family and popularity
